short_summary: Award for construction of a new green micro-grid power generation system at Sable Island National Park Reserve.
description: Construction of a new micro-grid power generation system at Sable Island National Park Reserve using solar panels and diesel generators.
full_summary:
**Title**: Stage 1 - Sable Island National Park Reserve Sustainable Micro-Grid
**Reference Number**: CB-253-5819826
**Solicitation Number**: 5P468-23-0234/A
**Publication Date**: November 17, 2023
**Closing Date**: November 28, 2023
**Status**: Expired

**Objectives**: Establish a sustainable micro-grid system at Sable Island National Park Reserve to meet the electrical demand of the island and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

**Scope of Work**: The project involves the design and construction of a new micro-grid system combining solar power, diesel-powered generators, and energy storage. The following scope includes:

1. Removal of existing diesel generators
2. Installation of two new parallel capable, variable-speed diesel electric generators with heat recovery systems
3. Installation of a new DC coupled solar photovoltaic array and energy storage system
4. Installation of a new micro-grid controller for energy storage and diesel generator management
5. Installation of occupancy sensor-based lighting controls for select buildings
6. Installation of new heating systems for select buildings
7. Replacement of electrical distribution equipment throughout Main Station.

**Tendering Process**: This is a two-stage selection process. Options selected to proceed to Stage 2 will be invited to submit a financial bid for the project.

**Exclusions**: Park Canada will not accept bids via SAP Ariba, bids must be received via fax to 1-855-983-1808 or email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca. Emails with attachments will only be accepted if they comply with the maximum file size of 15 megabytes.

**Relation with Existing Contracts**: The pre-qualification list will expire within 180 days or upon contract award, whichever is earlier.

**Specific Requirements**: Suppliers bidding on this project must comply with National Park Regulations and meet Canadian regulatory requirements. The RFP and all issuance related thereto will be considered accepted by the preceding day's solicitation closing.

**Currency and Taxes**: Supplier accepted to this contract must charge and include HST or other as per the Tax Act.

**Changes and Addenda**: Updates or Addenda affecting the RFP including price, will not imply acceptance of supplier offer. They also imply this buyer will carry liability only to the extent as given under Procurement Regulations.
